reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read about Brela in Lonely Planet and once we arrived, decided to stay two nights instead of island hopping to Hvar as the town is lovely and quaint, not too big and the beach is one of the best on the coast. We used Booking.com mobile app to find a place to stay and chose Villa Dalmatino based on its modern clean look and price. When we arrived in Brela we called the number on the sign outside the apartment and asked if they had any vacancies (we knew there was space via booking.com). The polite and helpful manager advised by phone that they didn't have any vacancies but when I mentioned booking.com he explained they couldn't sell us that room as it was exclusive to the reservation system. I suggested that perhaps I could I book it on my mobile and he agreed. It was a strange way to acquire a room but it worked!
reviews.title: Great little apartment a minute from the beach

reviews.text: We booked a one bedroom apartment on the ground floor for $59 euros per night. It was perfect! Modern, clean and all the amenities. Two lovely Croatian ladies arrived minutes after we completed the booking online and helped us with the paperwork and keys and although neither spoke English it all worked out great. We were provided the parking spot right beside our unit which was really nice as it has been mention parking is very difficult in Brela.
reviews.title: There is better quality/price ratio in Brela
